sen.j: 小紋（こもん）は日本の着物（和服）の種類の一つ。
sen.e: Komon is a kind of Japanese kimono (Japanese clothes).
Komon is a kind of Japanese kimono (Japanese clothes).
Komon is a kind of Japanese kimono (Japanese clothes).

sen.j: 全体に細かい模様が入っていることが名称の由来である。
sen.e: As it literally means, komon has fine pattern in whole garment.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処。
sen.e: As it literally means, komon has fine pattern all over the whole garment.
As it literally means, komon has fine pattern all over the whole kinomo.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: 訪問着、付け下げ等が肩の方が上になるように模様付けされているのに対し、小紋は上下の方向に関係なく模様が入っている。
sen.e: While homongi (semi-ceremonial kimono) and tsukesage have a pattern placed so that shoulder side is up, komon has a pattern regardless of the direction.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処。
sen.e: While homongi (semi-ceremonial kimono) and tsukesage have a pattern placed so that shoulder side is up, komon is patterned regardless of the direction.
While homongi (semi-ceremonial kimono) and tsukesage have patterns placed so that shoulder side is up, komon is patterned regardless of the direction.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: そのため礼装、正装としての着用は出来ない（江戸小紋を除く、理由は後述）。
sen.e: For that reason, it may not be worn as formal dress or full dress (the reason for excluding Edo-komon is mentioned later).
For that reason, it may not be worn as formal dress or full dress (the reason for excluding Edo-komon is mentioned later).
For that reason, it may not be worn as formal or full dress (the reason for excluding Edo-komon is mentioned later).
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: 現在は模様の大きさや密度に関わらず、上下方向関係なく模様が入っている着物は総称して「小紋」という。
sen.e: Regardless of the size or density of a pattern, kimono that has a pattern without particular direction is generically called "komon" nowadays.
Regardless of the size or density of the pattern, a kimono that has a pattern without a particular direction is generically called "komon" nowadays.
Regardless of the size or density of the pattern, a kimono that has a pattern without a particular direction is generically called 'komon' nowadays.

sen.j: 染めの技法によって「紅型小紋」「絞り小紋」「更紗小紋」など多種多様な小紋が存在する。
sen.e: There are various komons, such as "Bingata komon", "tie-dyed komon", and "printed cotton komon", depending on the dyeing technique.
There are various komon, such as "Bingata komon," "tie-dyed komon," and "printed cotton komon," that depend upon the dyeing technique.
There are various komon, such as 'Bingata komon,' 'tie-dyed komon,' and 'printed cotton komon,' that depend upon the dyeing technique.

sen.j: その中で、主な「小紋」の技法として知られるのは「江戸小紋」「京小紋」「加賀小紋」である。
sen.e: Among them, "Edo-komon", "Kyo-komon", and the "Kaga-komon" are recognized as the main "komon" techniques.
Among them, "Edo-komon," "Kyo-komon," and "Kaga-komon" are recognized as examples of the main "komon" techniques.
Among them, 'Edo-komon,' 'Kyo-komon,' and 'Kaga-komon' are recognized as examples of the main techniques of 'komon'.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: 江戸時代、諸大名が着用した裃の染めに由来する小紋。
sen.e: It is a komon originated in the dyeing of kamishimo (samurai costume, old ceremonial costume), which feudal lords wore in the Edo period.
This is a komon that originated in the dyeing of kamishimo (samurai costume, old ceremonial costume), which feudal lords wore during the Edo period.
This is komon that originated in the dyeing of kamishimo (samurai costume, old ceremonial costume), which feudal lords wore during the Edo period.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: 現在は「江戸小紋」と「東京おしゃれ小紋」の二種に分類されている。
sen.e: At present, it is classified into two kinds, "Edo-komon" and "Tokyo oshare-komon".
At present, it is classified into two types, the "Edo-komon" and the "Tokyo oshare-komon."
At present, it is classified into two types, the 'Edo-komon' and the 'Tokyo oshare-komon.'

sen.j: 1976年（昭和51年）6月2日に伝統的工芸品に認定された。
sen.e: It was recognized as one of the Traditional Craft on June 2, 1976.
It was recognized as one of the Traditional Japan Crafts on June 2, 1976.
It was recognized as one of the Traditional Japan Crafts on June 2, 1976.

sen.j: 江戸時代、諸大名が着用した裃の模様付けが発祥。
sen.e: It is originated in the pattern of kamishimo, which feudal lords wore in the Edo period.
It originated with the pattern of kamishimo, which feudal lords wore during the Edo period.
It originated from the pattern of kamishimo, which feudal lords wore during the Edo period.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: その後、大名家間で模様付けの豪華さを張り合うようになり、江戸幕府から規制を加えられる。
sen.e: Then, families of feudal lords started to compete for luxury of pattern, and it was regulated by the Edo bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun).
Then, families of feudal lords started to compete for luxury of pattern, and it was regulated by the Edo bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun).
Meanwhile, families of feudal lords started to compete for luxury of patterns, and it was regulated by the Edo bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun).
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: そのため、遠くから見た場合は無地に見えるように模様を細かくするようになった。
sen.e: For that reason, small patterns were created so that it looked solid color from a distance.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処。
sen.e: For that reason, small patterns were created so that it looked like a solid color from a distance.
For that reason, small patterns were created so that it looked like a solid color from a distance.

sen.j: 結果、かえって非常に高度な染色技を駆使した染め物となった。
sen.e: As a result, it turned to be highly skilled dye work.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処。
sen.e: As a result, it turned out to be a highly skilled dye work.
As a result, it turned out to be a highly skilled dyeing technique.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: また、各大名で使える模様が固定化していった。
sen.e: Moreover, the pattern that could be used by each feudal lord was determined.
Moreover, a pattern that could be used by each feudal lord was determined.
On the other hand, a pattern that could be used by each feudal lord was determined.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: 代表的な模様として「鮫」（紀州藩徳川氏）、「行儀」「角通し」（以上をまとめて「三役」という）、「松葉」（徳川氏）「御召し十」（徳川氏）「万筋」、「菊菱」（加賀藩前田氏）、「大小あられ」（薩摩藩島津氏）「胡麻柄」（佐賀藩鍋島氏）がある。
sen.e: The signature patterns are "shark" for Tokugawa clan of Kishuu domain, "gyogi", "Kakutoshi", (above three patterns are called "sanyaku (the notable three)", "pine needle" for Tokugawa clan, "omeahiju" for Tokugawa clan, "mansuji", "chrysanthemum-diamond" for Maeda clan of Kaga Domain, "daisho arare" for Shimazu clan of Satsuma Domain, and "sesame pattern" for Nabeshima clan of Saga domain..

The signature patterns are "sharks" for the Tokugawa clan of the Kishuu domain, "gyogi," "Kakutoshi," (the above three patterns are called "sanyaku - the notable three)," "pine needles" for the Tokugawa clan, "omeahiju" for Tokugawa clan, "mansuji," "chrysanthemum-diamond" for the Maeda clan of the Kaga Domain, "daisho arare" for the Shimazu clan of the Satsuma Domain, and "sesame pattern" for the Nabeshima clan of Saga domain..

The signature patterns are 'sharks' for the Tokugawa clan of the Kishu Domain, 'gyogi,' 'Kakutoshi,' (the above three patterns are called 'sanyaku' - the notable three), 'pine needles' for the Tokugawa clan, 'omeshiju' for Tokugawa clan, 'mansuji,' 'kikubishi' for the Maeda clan of the Kaga Domain, 'daisho arare' for the Shimazu clan of the Satsuma Domain, and 'gomagara' for the Nabeshima clan of Saga Domain.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: いっぽう、庶民もこの小紋を真似するようになる。
sen.e: Meanwhile, common people began to imitate the komon.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処。
sen.e: Meanwhile, common people began to imitate the komon.
Meanwhile, common people began to imitate the komon.

sen.j: こちらは生活用品など身近にある物を細かい模様にして洒落を楽しんだ。
sen.e: They made ordinarily objects like livingware into fine pattern and enjoyed fashion.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処。
sen.e: They made ordinarily objects like livingware into a fine pattern and enjoyed the demand for this fashion.
They made ordinarily objects like tools into a fine pattern and enjoyed the demand for this fashion.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: 江戸小紋は型紙を使って染めるのが特徴である。
sen.e: Edo-komon is characterized by dyeing using a paper pattern.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処。
sen.e: Edo-komon is characterized by dyeing using a paper pattern.
Edo-komon is characterized by dyed using a paper pattern.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: しかし、この型紙は江戸で作ることが出来ず、もっぱら伊勢に注文していた（伊勢型紙）。
sen.e: However, since the paper patterns could not be made in Edo, all of them were ordered in Ise (Ise dyed pattern paper).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処。
sen.e: However, since the paper patterns could not be made in Edo, all of them were ordered from Ise (Ise dyed pattern paper).
However, since the paper patterns could not be made in Edo, all of them were ordered from Ise (Ise dyed pattern paper).

sen.j: 現在は染め職人より型紙職人の後継者不足が江戸小紋の問題となっている。
sen.e: At present, shortage of successor to paper pattern artisans became larger issue of Edo-komon, rather than dye artisan.
At present, shortage of successors to paper pattern artisans became a larger issue for Edo-komon, rather the than dye artisan.
At present, shortage of successors to paper pattern artisans became a larger issue of Edo-komon, rather than dye artisan.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: 柄行きにもよるが、上記のように大名が着用していたという経緯から江戸小紋は格式が高い。
sen.e: Although it depends on design, Edo-komon has a high formality because it used be worn by feudal lord as described above.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処。
sen.e: Although it depends on design, Edo-komon exhibits a high formality because it used to be worn by a feudal lord as described above.
It depends on design, but Edo-komon exhibits a high formality because it used to be worn by a feudal lord as described above.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: 背中に家紋を入れることで色無地と同格になり、準礼装となる便利な着物である。
sen.e: It is useful kimono that may be used as semi-formal dress since it is treated like iromuji (solid colored kimono) when Kamon (family crest) is added on the back.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処。
sen.e: It is useful kimono that may be used as a semi-formal dress since it is treated like iromuji (solid colored kimono) when Kamon (the family crest) is added on the back.
It is useful kimono such that may be used as a semi-formal dress since it is treated like iromuji (solid colored kimono) when the family crest is added on the back.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: 「江戸小紋」の名称は昭和30年（1955年）に東京都の小宮康助が重要無形文化財保持者（人間国宝）に認定された際に「京小紋」と区別するために名づけられた。
sen.e: Edo-komon was named in order to differentiate from "Kyo-Komon" when Kosuke KOMIYA of Tokyo was designated as the holder of Important Intangible Cultural Property (Living National Tresure) in 1955.
Edo-komon was named in order to differentiate from "Kyo-Komon" when Kosuke KOMIYA of Tokyo was designated as the holder of Important Intangible Cultural Property, (Living National Tresure) in 1955.
Edo-komon' was named in order to differentiate from 'Kyo-Komon' when Kosuke KOMIYA of Tokyo was designated as the holder of Important Intangible Cultural Property (Living National Treasure) in 1955.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: 東京染小紋の技法を用いながら現代的な模様・染料を用いたもの。
sen.e: It is made with modern pattern and dye, employing the technique of Tokyo some-komon.
It is made with modern pattern and dye, employing the technique of Tokyo some-komon.
It is made by using modern pattern and dye, employing the technique of Tokyo some-komon.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: 江戸小紋と区別するため東京おしゃれ小紋と呼ぶ。
sen.e: It is called Tokyo oshare-komon in order to differentiate from Edo-komon.
It is called Tokyo oshare-komon in order to differentiate it from Edo-komon.
It is called Tokyo oshare-komon in order to differentiate it from Edo-komon.

sen.j: 古くから型染め技法を使って着物を制作していた京都だが、型染めを駆使した小紋生産が隆盛したのは明治時代以降である。
sen.e: Although kimono had been manufactured using stencil dyeing technique in Kyoto for a long time, it was after Meiji Period that komon production, fully employing stencil dyeing, flourished.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処。
sen.e: Although kimono had been manufactured using a stencil dyeing technique in Kyoto for a long time, it was after the Meiji Period that komon production, fully employing stencil dyeing, it flourished.

Although various types of kimono had been manufactured using a stencil dyeing technique in Kyoto for a long time, it was after the Meiji period that komon production, fully employing stencil dyeing, flourished.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: 京友禅の派手な柄いきと型染めを融合させたものを一般的に「京小紋」という。
sen.e: Fusing bright design of Kyoto yuzen and stencil dyeing is generally called "Kyo-Komon.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処。
sen.e: Fusing the bright designs of Kyoto yuzen and stencil dyeing, is generally called "Kyo-Komon.
Fusing of the bright designs of Kyoto yuzen and stencil dyeing is generally called 'Kyo-Komon.'
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: 単色染めの江戸小紋に対して多色染めである。
sen.e: In contrast to the Edo-komon of single color dyeing, it is multicolor dyeing.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処。
sen.e: In contrast to the Edo-komon of a single color, it is called multicolor dyeing.
In contrast to the Edo-komon of a single color, it is made by multicolor dyeing.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: 当然ながら一つ一つの柄も江戸小紋より大きく、抽象柄より具象柄が多く、見た目が華やかである。
sen.e: Therefore, its single pattern is larger and its appearance is showier than Edo-komon, and it has more concreteness design than abstract design.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処。
sen.e: Therefore, its single pattern is larger and its appearance is showier than Edo-komon, and it has more concreteness to the design than an abstract design.
Therefore, its single pattern is larger and its appearance is gorgeous than Edo-komon, and it has more concreteness to the design than an abstract design.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: 上記「京小紋」の影響を受けて石川県で作られ始めたのが「加賀小紋」であり、色使いに加賀友禅の技法が取り入れられている。
sen.e: Being influenced by "Kyo-Komon", mentioned above, "Kaga-komon" was started to be manufactured in Ishikawa prefecture, using technique of Kaga Yuzen for coloring.
Being influenced by "Kyo-Komon," mentioned above, "Kaga-komon" started to be manufactured in Ishikawa prefecture, using the technique of Kaga Yuzen for coloring.
Being influenced by 'Kyo-Komon,' mentioned above, 'Kaga-komon' started to be manufactured in Ishikawa Prefecture by using the technique of Kaga Yuzen for coloring.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: 一方で「江戸小紋」の影響を受けて作られた「加賀小紋」も石川県には存在する。
sen.e: On the other hand, in Ishikawa prefecture, there is also "Kaga komon" that is influenced by "Edo-komon".
On the other hand, in Ishikawa prefecture, there is also "Kaga komon" that was influenced by "Edo-komon".
On the other hand, there is also 'Kaga komon' that was influenced by 'Edo-komon' in Ishikawa Prefecture.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。
